label: Description
value: Scene with dancing figures.  Palace of the Doges on right, library on left.  Also the campanile of St. Marks, the Mint, and a church.  Right edge of each section taped to folding cardboard mount of which parts g and h are cross members.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James Ward Thorne

value: Six figures in histrionic poses in a setting of arches and porticoes with columns in blue. At back, a fountain and pool in a formal garden. label: Physical description
value: Engraving, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James Ward Thorne

label: Description
value: Horizontal composition with upper corners rounded. Snowy scene showing three riders being thrown from a sleigh. Additional horse-drawn sleighs in the background.  A sign in the distance, at left, reads: St. Nicholas.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving in black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Groups of people on the Boston Common on a windy day, with fountain at left and stairs at right.  Children play with hoops.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving in black ink on paper
The War for the Union, 1862 – A Bayonet Charge

label: Description
value: Double page illustration for Harper's Weekly. Union soldiers charge from the left, bayonettes pointed ahead, towards the battle, at right. At lower left, a Union offier is shown with sword drawn, his back to the observer.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving in black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Serpentine front, rounded ends, cabriole legs fitted with castors; back of serpentine profile, raised high in circle at one end and crowned with pierced cresting of laminated wood in scrolls and acanthus shoots. Cluster of flowers in relief at center of arched back, and another at center of apron. Upholstered in contemporaneous machine-woven fancy compound satin, tufted on back.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edwin Gould [1]; 1937: acquired by Museum          [1] Previously owned by Mrs. Hester Ellen Cantine Shrady, donor's mother

label: Description
value: Shaped back, curved in plan, with openwork design of laminated wood in plain and foliate scrolls, and carved bunch of flowers at top.  Carving on front of apron; turning on outcarving front legs, which are fitted with casters.  Seat upholstered in blue silk damask (not original).

label: Physical description
value: carved laminated and steamed rosewood veneer, oak (frame), silk upholstery (not original)

label: Provenance
value: Hester Ellen Contine Shrady, mother of donor; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Shaped back, curved in plan, with ovoid escutcheon surrounded by openwork design of laminated wood in scrolls; cabriole legs, the front pair fitted with castors. Upholstered in comtemporaneous machine-woven fancy compound satin. Pressed, steamed, laminated in layers, then glued together at right angles; with an applied crest.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edwin Gould [1]; 1937: acquired by Museum          [1] Previously owned by Mrs. Hester Ellen Cantine Shrady, donor's mother

label: Description
value: Circular dish, kylix-shaped, with pierced decoration in form of cross embellishment with diamond-shaped elements at end of arms and between them. Strap handles and in lead design, slightly raised.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Hartford W.H. Powel Jr.; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Large dinner napkin of white linen damask. Design of flower filled urn, palmettes, etc. Border design of highly conventionalized floral motifs. At center of lower border the date, 1731, and a crown over the letter "C" are embroidered in red linen.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 95 x 81.5 cm (37 3/8 x 32 1/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Flowers and leaves of stamped metal. Twelve leaves soldered to flaring circular stems surround three smaller leaves and twenty-five flowers mounted on wire stems rising from a common base. Topmost flower, center, has five large petals enclosing blossom in three layers.

label: Provenance
value: A present for the tenth wedding anniversary of Mr. and Mrs. George T. Bliss, February 12, 1889.

label: Description
value: Stamped eight-pointed star with flat circular center. A wire skewer is soldered to the back.

label: Provenance
value: A present for the tenth wedding anniversary of Mr. and Mrs. George T. Bliss, February 12, 1889.

label: Description
value: Pair of tin slippers on short heels; looped tin ribbons with nothced ends and stamped oval tin buckles mounted at tongues. Each heel, instep, back and sole made separately, soldered together.

label: Provenance
value: 1937: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Sheet metal. On one side, engraved script reading "Feb. 12, 1879-1889". Reverse, plan. Corners cut at angle of 45 degrees. Small punched hole with yellowed ribbon in upper left corner.

label: Provenance
value: A present for the tenth wedding anniversary of Mr. and Mrs. George T. Bliss, February 12, 1889.

label: Description
value: Table is oval half-round in shape, supported on four scroll legs. Curved stretcher with openwork crest. Shaped plinth surmounted by two shelves of graduated size with shaped profile edges, supported on pierced fretwork brackets. Back of two upper shelves fitted with mirror glass. Top of second shelf surmounted by scrollwork with central escutcheon and high relief female head. Finial above head missing. Central drawer on table front, with front panel carved with arabesques and grape clusters. Interior of drawer of maple, with rectangular brass locking device.

label: Provenance
value: 1937: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Notes
value: Table is oval half-round in shape, supported on four scroll legs. Curved stretcher with openwork crest. Shaped plinth surmounted by two shelves of graduated size with shaped profile edges, supported on pierced fretwork brackets. Back of two upper shelves fitted with mirror glass. Top of second shelf surmounted by scrollwork with central escutcheon and high relief female head. Finial above head missing. Central drawer on table front, with front panel carved with arabesques and grape clusters. Interior of drawer of maple, with rectangular brass locking device.

label: Description
value: Fragment from toile "Jeanne d' Arc, a copper plate print. Jeanne is shown in armor, on horseback, bearing a banner with the word "France". Following her are two armed horsemen, and a man on foot with the word "CHARLE-" on the yoke of his shirt. Troops and castle in background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: A stooped older woman with a cloth across her head and shoulders. Her bodice is loosely tied. She carried a jug in one hand and wears a simple bag across her body, over an apron.

label: Provenance
value: A. Algara R. de Terreros; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of A. Algara R de Terreros

label: Description
value: Striding male figure on circular based. Bearded. Carries sack of chicory on right shoulder. Cap and bandana cover head and neck. Shirt and jerkin open at neck. Coat unbuttoned. Bag on right shoulder. Knee breeches and underclothes with visible buttons. Leggings and sandals.

label: Provenance
value: Algara R. de Terreros; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of A. Algara R. de Terreros

label: Description
value: Cobalt blue on white ground. Conventionalized plant design of three tulips on single leafy stem within a circular scrolled cartouche extending to edges. Fret ornament in corners.

label: Description
value: Square shawl with a small red center. Embroidered in a multicolored cone and flower design.

label: Description
value: Man's short waistcoat with standing collar, notched hem and pocket flaps. In white silk satin embroidered with an all-over design of small floral sprigs and densely embroidered on the front and lower edges with floral vine, in pale blues, greens and yellows.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered in satin stitches on twill weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1937: Mrs. Montgomery Hare collection; 1937: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Coat of changeable brown and blue silk faille with small ovals. Embroidered with floral motif in polychrome silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound weave, embroidered

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (Height of Center back; Shoulder Width): 114.3 × 33 cm (45 × 13 in.)

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. In and out pattern of scrolling and crossing stems with five-petalled flowers at the intersections. Outlined in dark green against a light olive green background with a mesh of gold lines and horizontal striations. Mounted on white paper backed with cloth. The flocking involves different colors of flock, printed on top of each other.

label: Provenance
value: From the entrance room/front hall of donor's father's house at 4 West 54th Street, New York, NY.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Davison Rockefeller, Jr.

label: Description
value: Repeat of leafy stems and rosettes in relief, gold on dull red. One half of each leaf textured with cross-hatching, pebbling, imbrication or venation unlike that of other half. Rosettes centered with Maltese crosses, circles of dots, etc. The metallic-gold floral pattern stands out in high relief from the maroon ground. Nearly square format.

label: Provenance
value: From dining room, donor's father's house, 4 West 54th Street, New York City.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Davison Rockefeller, Jr.

label: Notes
value: Repeat of leafy stems and rosettes in relief, gold on dull red. One half of each leaf textured with cross-hatching, pebbling, imbrication or venation unlike that of other half. Rosettes centered with Maltese crosses, circles of dots, etc. The metallic-gold floral pattern stands out in high relief from the maroon ground. Nearly square format.

label: Description
value: Four tiles comprising a square portion of a larger composition in Persian style. This unit centered with a quatrefoil design enclosed by four semicircular stems and decorated corners, details reserved in white. Underglaze colors: burnt sienna, green, two shades of blue, on white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Davison Rockefeller, Jr.

label: Description
value: Hand painted. Side view of a nymph enframed in a garlanded rectangle supported by a frieze of cherubs. On either side are columns supporting female busts. Across top a horizontal band of flying swans, masks, across bottom a band of linked rectangles and trefoil arches.

label: Physical description
value: Hand painted in oil pigments on canvas

label: Provenance
value: From the the bathroom of donor's father's house, 4 West 54th Street, New York, NY.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Davison Rockefeller, Jr.

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting grass in seed

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil on black paper

label: Provenance
value: Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a linden branch with leaves and berries. On verso, three studies of raspberry canes.

label: Provenance
value: Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney
Study of Clematis Vine with Blue Berries

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting branches of clematis vines, with leaves in autumnal coloring, and blue berries.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on gray paper

label: Provenance
value: Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney
Stuy of Maidenhair Fern, Trumpet Vine and Nasturtium

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting studies of maidenhair fern, trumpet vine and nasturtium naturalistically rendered. On verso, studies of roses, hollyhock leaves and elm trees.

label: Provenance
value: Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting six fronds of Boston or Christmas fern on the recto.  On verso, fronds of the same fern depicted from various angles.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on blue-green paper

label: Provenance
value: Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet depicting four sprays of dogwood with two single blossoms.
